course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Af.Am.Sport History/ATL Archiv
class_notes: (This course introduces student to African American Sport History, a subfield of African American History. Relying on historical research and methods, this course uses sports as an analytical lens to study the social, intellectual, political, economic, and cultural history of African Americans in the United States. More specifically, we will focus on the history and culture of African American/Black athletes and Black sporting communities and institutions like Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) in Atlanta, the state of Georgia, and the South in the 20th century. Together, we will explore the archives, physically and digitally, and initiate Oral History, Public History, and Digital History projects that explore several key themes, topics, and issues surrounding African American/Black participation in sports.)
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 4097, Section #: 7, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 4-6:45p, Instructor: R. Rahim, Status: Open
